page.title: 03Forestry,Whinlatter Pass
page.content: About three square kilometres of the sector is{conifer plantation.}It is part of{Thornthwaite Forest,}one of the oldest Forestry Commission woods, planted in{1919.}Altogether it covers about 25 square kilometres, mainly on Whinlatter Pass and around nearby Bassenthwaite Lake. The land is generally{steep}with {poor stony soil,}covered with{heather, {coarse grass}and{bracken,}so not many types of tree will grow in such conditions.The commonest kind is{Sitka {spruce,}plus{Norway spruce,Douglas fir and{Japanese larch. The wood is used for{pulp,building {timber,fencing,posts,boards}and {pallets.}Small trees are also sold at Christmas. Further along the Pass are the {Visitors Information Centre,picnic {areas}and marked{woodland walks.
